results.title: Respecting differences
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Government and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that migrant children have in adjusting to Australian schools and culture, especially non-English speaking children. Recently the New South Wales Government has given funds to support the teaching of ethnic languages in many state schools which helps facilitate adjustment to Australian life.

results.title: Researching the topic
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Finding out”.
Demonstrates the principles of student research through the experiences of a secondary student who is required to do a research project on any aspect of “people and work”. As the practicalities of the task are confronted the audience is guided through the key stages of project planning, information collection and processing, formulating conclusions and presentation. Accompanied by 13p Teacher Notes.

results.title: Researching the story
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode overviews the first part of storytelling - finding a story people can relate to. It describes research techniques such as defining what is a story, story telling styles, finding the angle, getting the facts, developing sources, finding the people, preparing the shoot, briefing the crew and meeting deadlines.

results.title: Research and modern housing
results.creator_credit: Richard F. Tambling, Julian Wintle and Verity Films
results.brief_description: Describes the work and experiments carried out at the Building Research Station of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, England. Shows new ideas for better, cheaper and quicker building techniques and the way this is helping to solve postwar housing problems in Britain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard F. Tambling, Julian Wintle and Verity Films

results.title: Rescue by helicopter
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones, Australia. Royal Australian Navy and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Standard procedures for rescue by a helicopter. Vertical take off and landing, and the ability to hover make it a valuable rescue craft. Shows correct method of approach, putting on the rescue strap, and giving the winding signal. Provided rules are adhered to helicopter rescue is quite safe. Edited by Richard Mitchell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones, Australia. Royal Australian Navy and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Requiem for a faith
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Elda Hartley and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: The traditional life of Tibet is depicted by Huston Smith, Professor of Philosophy at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Smith shows the extent to which traditional customs have been invaded and corroded by the West. All social and economic activity revolves around religious practice. The importance of the Dalai Lama is emphasised. Set in Gyuto Tantric Monastery in Northern India, this moving film explores the essence of Tibetan Buddhism and focuses on the unusual chants of the Gyuto monks, whose training enables them to chant in chords. The film was shot mainly in Dalhousie, India, where the two Tantric Colleges, Gyuto and Gyume, were re-established in exile.

results.title: Republic day: India
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The celebrations in Delhi on India’s national day, 26th January. The President drives in State to take the salute at a parade of armed forces, floats representing the various provinces and industries, folk dances and marching schoolchildren. Illuminations and fireworks enliven the city at night. The following day a fold dance festival shows the dances of many districts. The military ceremony of Beating the Retreat concludes the festivities.

results.title: Republic Day, 1955
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The pageantry witnessed in the capital on Republic Day. Colorful tableaux representing the achievements and developments of the national plans in different areas, the spectacular parade of the three units of the Armed Forces, and a brilliant display of fireworks.
